organic.title: Occupational Noise Exposure - Overview - OSHA
organic.snippet: OSHA requires employers to implement a hearing conservation program when noise exposure is at or above 85 decibels averaged over 8 working hours.

organic.title: Occupational Noise Exposure - Hearing Conservation Program
organic.snippet: Focuses on how hearing conservation programs can address the needs of hearing-impaired workers who are exposed to high levels of noise in their workplace.

organic.title: About Occupational Hearing Loss | Noise - CDC
organic.snippet: Occupational hearing loss is permanent but preventable. Exposure to loud noise or certain chemicals while at work can damage your hearing.

organic.title: Occupational Hearing Disorders - Types Of Hearing Loss
organic.snippet: New Jersey Hearing & Tinnitus Center helps address occupational hearing disorders. A significant concern in workplaces around the world, occupational ...
